author: GamingBolt
description:
Despite some caveats, I would still recommend Sword of the Sea for those seeking a relatively light adventure with outstanding art direction, movement, and music. 

The fact that it fires on so many cylinders, from the world design to the overall joy of exploration, and yet fails to enthral me in so many meaningful ways, remains baffling. 

But as endearing as it can be to get lost among the waves, you need something to eventually anchor yourself, and for better or worse, Giant Squid doesn't quite deliver on that front.
title: Sword of the Sea Review - The Final Verdict

author: GamingBolt
description:
Metal Gear Solid Delta: Snake Eater is shaping up to be a faithful yet polished remake of the PS2 classic that defined stealth gameplay for a generation. 

While Kojima isn’t involved for this project, Konami and Virtuos Studios has surely impressed fans by preserving the game’s core identity while enhancing visuals with Unreal Engine 5, improving animations, and adding subtle quality-of-life tweaks. 

The original release is a very precious memory of my childhood, and it continues to serve as a formative experience that heavily contributed to building my gaming tastes.

The opportunity to replay that experience in a new light just feels like a dream come true for a long time fan like myself but it’s an even better opportunity for newcomers to experience the chronological start of Metal Gear Solid.
title: I Was A Kid When Metal Gear Solid 3: Snake Eater Released, And I Can’t Wait To Play The Remake

author: GamingBolt
description:
This year’s NHL game from EA Sports is upping the ante when it comes to goalies, and other mechanics. In addition to a goalie overhaul, real life data compiled from NHL EDGE has been implemented across various aspects of the game. 

NHL 26 seems like another iterative entry in the series and not a complete makeover. In fact, there’s no new modes that’ve been revealed yet for the game, so expect a similar, yet more refined, package.

We’ve compiled the top 15 things worth knowing about NHL 26 before considering a purchase. The game’s standard edition releases for $69.99 on September 12 for PS5 and Xbox Series X/S and is available for early access players from September 5th.
title: NHL 26 - 15 New Details You Need To Know BEFORE YOU BUY
